title: Relative 2D Motion - Student and Falling Fruit

content.question: What is the speed of the apple as a function of <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"> <mi>t</mi> </math> as observed by the student?

choices.label: <math alttext="v sub 0, end sub, plus g t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><mi>g</mi><mi>t</mi></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the square root of v sub 0, end sub, squared, plus open parenthesis, g t, close parenthesis, squared, end root" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msqrt><mrow><msup><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></msqrt></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the square root of v sub 0, end sub, squared, plus open parenthesis, g t, close parenthesis, squared, end root" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msqrt><mrow><msup><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></msqrt></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
